g.text: Rn contained in the breath of patients treated with
-ray spectrometry with an HPGe detector and breath collection bags.
was observed, the estimated internal radiation exposure to caregivers via the inhalation
Rn was small and should not affect the release criteria of patients who have been
Area under the curve; CRPC: Castration-resistant prostate cancer; HP: High purity; ICRP: International Commission
on Radiological Protection; PMDA: Pharmaceutical and Medical Devices Agency
We would like to thank Yoshihide Nakamura, Japan Radioisotope Association, for his excellent technical supervision.
We also thank Atsushi Toyoshima, Institute for Radiation Sciences, Osaka University, for his useful comments on the
article. Finally, we are grateful to Kazuya Yamaguchi and Shuuhei Kawaguchi, Osaka University Hospital, for their
support on the breath collection and the measurement.
KO, TW, and TK contributed the study design and conducted the study. KO drafted the manuscript. TW, MH, and JH
contributed the revise of the manuscript. TY, AS, and JH were the supervisors of the study. All authors read and
This study was funded by a radiation safety regulation research strategic promotion project from the Nuclear
The datasets generated during and/or analyzed during the current study are available from the corresponding author
Ethics approval and consent to participate
The study protocol was approved by the institutional review board of Osaka University Hospital.
The authors declare that they have no competing interests.

de in men with castration-resistant prostate cancer. Health Phys. 2014;106:494
